item.title: On September 3, 2019 the Mets lost all playoff hopes.
item.description: The New York Mets had a legitimate chance to make the 2019 playoffs. They had 10 players with an OPS+ higher than 100, the NL CY Young Award winner in Jacob deGrom and all six starters had an ERA+ of slightly below or above 100. So why did they not make the playoffs? The meltdown game. On a late night in early September, the Mets showed why when they gave up a six-run lead with one out in the bottom of the ninth inning to the eventual World Series Championship, The Washington Nationals.
